### Summary of the new feature / enhancement

Hey, I wasn't sure where to report this, I tried StackOverflow and Technet too but didn't get any response, wanted to know why is [CimCmdlets] module is not supported on platforms other than Windows? I've got a script that I need to run on both Linux and windows but couldn't do that because this module is missing. Also, the Get-WmiObject commandlet doesn't seem to be working on Linux.
FYI- The script I'm running is basically using -computerName flag and the device mentioned for this tag is a windows machine only. with the script, we are trying to fetch the windows device information on the Linux machines.

comments.author: jhoneill
comments.body:
Get-WmiObject is not in PowerShell 6 or 7.  It is only in Windows PowerShell 5. There's been a push to get people to use the "CIM" named commands instead of "WMI" named ones. ( Cim and WMI are the same thing, but the older commands do remoting over DCOM and the new ones do remoting over WSMAN.)
  
Generally where something has a -ComputerName parameter it is using Windows-centric networking. If it has a -Hostname parameter that is for SSH.  AFAIK PowerShell's route into and out of Linux is SSH only, (no WSMAN) so you need to configure PowerShell access over ssh on Windows and then run the command you need in a remote session.

comments.author: jhoneill
comments.body:
Just found something I thought I knew was wrong
In the Windows Sandbox (effectively a VM on my Laptop) I can remote to my own machine with   
`New-PSSession -ComputerName 192.168.0.39 -Credential $mycred` 

On WSL the same command gives an access denied (my memory was the `-ComputerName` parameter wasn't available on Linux), it gives this error as the first one which suggests more support for the WSMan than I thought. 

```
System.Management.Automation.Remoting.Client.WSManClientSessionTransportManager.Initialize(Uri connectionUri, WSManConnectionInfo connectionInfo)
```
I had the firewall rules wrong so the sandbox couldn't connect, but the WSL was still coming back with access denied pretty much instantly, so I don't think the error is generated without ever sending anything from the Linux side. 

@kasini3000   is your stuff enabling WSMAN from Linux to Windows? 

(doesn't change the substantive point that the CIM module isn't available, but it might open the chance to change that).
